result.execSummary:
The defendant Elizabeth A Hoen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE/schooling/combination of the two.
Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol.  Deft may take valid prescription and only take as recommended.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling deemed necessary by agent.  Complete AODA with follow through.  Complete mental health assessment and own victimization issues being addressed.  

DNA sample.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:22am
INCLUDES 16CF311, 16CF344, 16CF585, 16CF587, 16CF1109, 16CM165, 16CM704
State appears by ADA Raymond Pelrine.  Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
16CF311:
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor- repeater >> D&RI
16CF344:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
16CF585:
Ct. 2 Possess Drug Paraphernalia, PTAC >> D&RI
16CF587:
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor- repeater, PTAC >> D&RI
16CF1109:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Felony >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
16CM165:
Ct. 1 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)- repeater >> D&RI
16CM704:
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA:
16CF311:
Ct. 1 Possession of Narcotic Drugs- repeater >> GUILTY
16CF585:
Ct. 1 Possession of Narcotic Drugs, PTAC >> GUILTY
16CF587:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony, PTAC- repeater >> GUILTY
Ct. 2 Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, PTAC >> GUILTY
16CM165:
Ct. 2 Hit and Run- repeater >> GUILTY
16CM704:
Ct. 1 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer- repeater >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. On felonies 16CF311 Ct. 1, 16CF585 Ct. 1, 16CF587 Ct. 1- 4 years probation. On misdemeanors 16CF587 Ct. 2, 16CM165 Ct. 2, 16CM704 Ct. 1- 2 years probation. All terms of probation to run concurrent to each other. CONDITION ONLY ON 16CF311 Ct. 1- Serve 5 months conditional jail. Jail may be with huber release for work, work search, or treatment if meets jail criteria. CONDITIONS on all counts: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Complete mental health assessment and own victimization issues being addressed. Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol, deft may take valid prescription and only take as recommended. Pay back restitution in 16CM165 of $1,000 to victim- B.C. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. Jail credit granted in 16CF311 of 101 days (does not go towards 5 months cond. jail), in 16CF585 126 days, in 16CF587 126 days, in 16CM165 100 days, in 16CM704 101 days.
